titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.repository: University of Delaware Special Collections Department Morris Library, 181 South College Avenue Newark, DE 19717-5267

bioghist.p: The Bird & Bull Press was founded by printer and papermaker Henry Morris in 1958 in Newtown, Pennsylvania. Since that time, Morris has produced broadsides, books, and other printed materials that are an important part of the contemporary American private press scene and significant documents in the art, craft, and history of hand papermaking. Morris first made paper as a commercial venture in 1958 for Cheney Pulp and Paper Company, later for his own books, and for friends.

scopecontent.p: The Bird & Bull Press records are a large collection of material dating from 1846, with the bulk of the material dating from the mid-1950s to 2006. The collection consists of a variety of materials relating to writing, printing, publication, and other topics. Much of the collection is arranged by title or project, with manuscripts, typescripts, layouts, galleys, and correspondence grouped together. The range of materials to be found in the collection is extensive; it includes typescripts, drawings, manuscripts, illustrations, typographic samples, production files, text samples, prospectuses, metal engravings, wood cuts, ink prints, paper matrix, printer's apron (autographed), proofs, embossing samples, paper samples, layout materials, dummies, page proofs, watermarks, wood blocks, paste papers, tear sheets, books, catalogs, magazines, articles, programs, certificates, orders, broadsides, signed prints, contracts, telegrams, trophies, woven wall hangings, paper weights, visitor badges, correspondence (personal and business), maps, invitations, inscribed shorts, financial papers, coins, greeting cards, medals, business cards, bills, and a Bird and Bull paper mold.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.
An online finding aid is available at http://www.lib.udel.edu/ud/spec/findaids/birdbull.htm.
